intro: Bupleurum haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
